Reviews.Title: “Rude and unhelpful staff! Poor housekeeping! Dirty floors!”
Reviews.Author: Gg t
Reviews.Content: Our experience with Marriott Hotel was the low point of our time in Rancho Bernardo. I asked for a room with a view for our wedding anniversary and was given the last one at the end of a very long hallway, looking towards the highway. Far from the elevator and with a baby in our hands, it made it extra difficult to get to our room! I found long strands of hair in bath tub, so had to cancel baby bath. The next day, for our housekeeping service, we had our bed made, but floor wasn't vacuumed. The Front office supervisor Teresa (the ONLY helpfull person) called later and send houskeeping to re-vacuum the carpet, unfortunately pieces of food were left behind (again) and I had to pick them up myself. Housekeepers at this hotel are somewhat rude and speak very limited English, if any..I asked one (older woman with grey, curly hair) for extra shampoo and towel. She refused to give me any and chased me down to my room to check if I had any bath items already. I didn't let her in, because baby was napping. Also, at breakfast , the server (male) made some inapropriate remarks..Our baby didn't eat much of his plate and my husband appologized for wasting some of the food ...The server's respond: WELCOME TO AMERICA! We felt as though we had been spoken to as if we were children looking for a handout! Very unprofessional! The lack of customer care and disrespect at this hotel will keep guests away. We would never be back! Shame on you, Marriott for wasting our time and money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff could not have been more helpful...”
Reviews.Author: ORLA77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, rooms and hotel so clean and nice. Good base 15 miles from downtown san diego well serviced by restaurants within 5 mins drive. Pool looked good weather too cold for kids to use. Staff so good and helpful, have to mention sara and rusty at reception! Will definitely be back...

Reviews.Title: “Hockey Tournament stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: Wow...we were greeted by a wonderful waitress who was more than happy to assist everyone. I just feel terrible that I did not write her name down. Anyhow, I would deffinatley stay here just because of the wonderful service this waitress gave each and every one of us. She actually took the time to get to know everyone's name...amazing! Great experience over all!

Reviews.Title: “Good Marriott quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: jguard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and lovely. My only complaint was that the restaurant/bar had one waitress the night we had dinner there and she was running ragged. I'm not sure if someone called out and they could not get her help or they are understaffed. She waited all tables plus bar patrons. I could not give service excellent rating due to this. Also, my air conditioner/heater made awful noise while on (or even when turned off???). I had to shut it off fo rminimal noise. Bed was very comfortable, staff helpful, room clean, check in/out excellent. It is far from a lot of things, but good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Regular Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: KJN1962
Reviews.Content: I travel routinely on business and mostly have long days of work. Typically I just would like a clean place to stay, comfortable bed, an iron that works, a television that gets a variety of channels, some decent food, and a dÃ©cor that doesnâ€™t look like something out of a 1970â€™s Quentin Tarantino movie. I struggle with The courtyard in Rancho San Bernardo, more often than not the room Iâ€™m booked into has a broken iron and a strange in odor (Itâ€™s not terribly bad, but not good either; maybe musty), The lighting always seems dim and the rooms could use a little updating. I could probably deal with all that but what most is frustrating is the half the time the television cable has issues where it is off and on. I have stayed there a number of times giving them the benefit of the doubt thinking maybe I had just a bad run of rooms. Well I think now I might now change hotels. I will say that the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Courtyard for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew E
Reviews.Content: Very friendly front desk staff. Clean and comfortable, nice views of park/lake. Make sure to request room away from highway, I didn't and it was noisy. Good for business trip, close proximity to highway (good and bad!) and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Very nice courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: RoadKing68
Reviews.Content: Location is not that great if you are touring San Diego, but for me (business) location was perfect. Very friendly staff. Rooms, lobby, etc was clean. Free wifi. No issues while here. They called me to let me know my take out was on the way up. It just felt like the staff took a little extra time to make me feel welcome. Kudos!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: BiztravelguyBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a quick business trip to the area. Staff is very pleasant and helpful. Early check-in was a breeze, despite the fact I had used Priceline - they treated me just as well as they would have treated one of their top-tier regular guests. Parking was free, the lot was safe. Within a short walking distance was a plaza with tons of shopping and eating options. I-15 is about 5 minutes away; downtown 25 minutes (note that rush hour traffic can be very much longer). Rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. I'd absolutely recommend this hotel. Excellent rating given for combination of price, location, staff friendliness and value for the buck. It's not the Ritz, but it sure does a lot better than most hotels in its class.

Reviews.Title: “Eh just okay”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just an average hotel. We chose this hotel because it was suggested to us by our friends who was having a wedding in the area. We had issues with the shuttle service that was suppose to be provided for the wedding. While the staff tried to be accommodating, initially the on duty manager was very difficult which was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Short Overnight Family visit”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_Z_2011
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for an overnight visit. The hotel is close to the I15 Freeway and you can hear the traffic noise when you enter the hotel. Our room faced the freeway but the traffic noise was not noticeable in the room. The hotel was very busy on Saturday am when we checked out. It appears the hotel is used by club soccer teams for overnight stays for weekend tournaments. So there will be a lot of kids staying in the rooms with parents. You can hear the noise from other rooms. The hotel does have a breakfast option but once again there will be a lot of kids. The hotel was fine for a short overnight stay to visit my elderly father who lives in assisted living. If I stayed longer in Rancho Bernardo, I would stay in a nicer place with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms BUT problem with shuttle for wedding”
Reviews.Author: johntimothyhopkins
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is pretty run of the mill for tier 3-4ish Marriott's. Everything was nice, clean, and the beds were awesome. I (and my wife) would prefer a normal door to the bathroom as opposed to the sliding door since its hard to keep smells out of the main room with a sliding door, but thats small. However we had more problems. My friends and I came to this hotel for a wedding we were in and we were promised shuttle service to the venue starting at 2pm (wedding starts at 3:30) for our wives since we only had one vehicle. When the girls came down to catch the shuttle, the front desk employee told them that the service wasn't going to start until 4pm. My wife asked for the manager and told them our situation and the manager was rude and not helpful. It got to the point that my wife called me and told me the situation and I felt like it was necessary to call them and let them know that I am a platinum member and this was unacceptable service for what I have come to know from Marriott's, etc... The manager had a change of heart and was very helpful to my wife, but it should not have come to this. As mistakes happen all the time in the HTM industry, its not the mistake but the response that counts, and the first response in this hotel drove my rating. As I said previously, the hotel is very nice for the price and would have received 4 stars barring my situation. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “annoying heater”
Reviews.Author: angelino
Reviews.Content: The heating and air are at the window. The fan does not turn off when the temperature is reached and the location of the unit,, in a 2 bed room, is right next to the head of a bed. The result is it is very noisy for the unlucky person getting that bed and the hot or, if the a/c is on, cold air blows directly on the head. I asked and was told all the 2 bed rooms were configured the same way,.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pretty Property and a Breakfast that Amazes”
Reviews.Author: Reenactress
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty property in a cul de sac adjacent to small restaurants, business parks, and a nice park with a duck pond. Rooms were comfortable. One thing that we didn't like was the sliding door to the bathroom as this was noisy. Also the wood front to the sink and counter seems a bit odd. One of our rooms had a safety bar in the shower/tub; another one did not. Microwave and fridge in each room. Check in staff friendly. On site breakfast is $11, all you can eat. Waffles and omelets cooked to order. We eat so much before going to the Wild ANimal Park that we did not eat til 7 PM that night. This is a pretty good bargain for breakfast. Large dining room, also an outdoor component with a barbeque that would be nice for warmer temps. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Well Maintained Hotel in Upscale Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get away for an evening without a long drive and without paying an exorbitant tariff. I checked every Marriott property in San Diego County and found this one in Rancho Bernardo to have the best pricing using the senior discounted rate. We got even more than we had bargained for when we arrived. At check in, Teresa at the front desk, noted my wife's Platinum Elite status and upgraded us without hesitating to a beautiful suite on the fourth floor facing a small park and lake. We didn't know Courtyards had suite accommodations, but the kind Teresa wanted us to be extra comfortable. This is an older hotel that was originally built as a Doubletree in the 80's, but has been maintained flawlessly since Marriott's takeover. Everything was absolutely spotless. I guess the only feature that dates the hotel slightly is the use of "pocket" doors to enter the bathroom. We enjoyed both dinner (room service) and a knock-your-socks-off buffet breakfast which was complimentary, although I'm not certain whether it was free for us as elite members or is offered to all guests. The cooked-to-order omelet was outstanding and my waffle with the works couldn't have been better. Paying guests were charged $11.95. The breakfast room is beautiful and one could eat al fresco weather permitting. My only minor issue with the hotel is the energy saving lighting which makes it difficult to read at night either in bed or elsewhere. But for the $80 we paid, we felt we received a terrific value at an exceptionally lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: beelacat
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review on my last night at this Courtyard property. Check in was very easy and the clerk that checked us in was very nice. Though the property seems like it is a bit older, our room is extremely clean and well kept. We are on the 3rd floor and overlook the pool/hot tub area and just beyond that is a beautifully landscaped man made lake. The hotel is very nice and kind of off the beaten path. Our room has a mini fridge and microwave in it. The bathroom has a pocket door instead of a regular door. The beds are a bit firm for my taste, but that's a personal opinion. I still sleep very good. The hotel has been very quiet except for one night (a Saturday), there was a group of young people coming in from what looked like a wedding party. They were a bit loud for about 5-10 minutes, but I never heard them after that. We have not eaten at the restaurant in the hotel so I can't comment on that. We have used the outdoor hot tub and it was wonderfully relaxing. It was about 58-60 degrees outside but once we got in the hot tub, we were nice and cozy. Both the hot tub and pool are very clean, but it was a bit too cold for the pool even though it is heated. I only have two complaints about this hotel. The first is that I rarely see anyone at the front desk. During peak times, like early morning before 10am, I have seen an employee, but later in the day and even at night, I don't see anyone. They may be in the office just off to the side of the main desk, but I'm not sure. The second is that the water pressure in the shower is great, however, it comes out so hard that it actually can be painful. Plus, I'm about 5'3" and my husband is about 5'8" and the shower head is very low, as is the ceiling. Not a big deal to me, but if you're taller than my husband, this could be an issue. We have been to SeaWorld and the San Diego Zoo and it took us about 20-25 minutes depending on traffic. This area is beautiful and it is in a business park. There are several restaurants in the area (Coco's, Denny's, etc.) There is also a post office and several banks and gas stations in the area. I am using the one computer in their business center and the internet connection is quick and efficient. Overall, I am very satisfied with this hotel and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ocInvestor2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. Staff was friendly. I was in a double queen bed room. The room was a good size and the beds comfortable. The room looked fresh, but the desk and cabinet furniture had some noticeable wear and tear. Nice large TV in the room with a good selection of channels. Breakfast buffet was pretty good. I was too rushed to take advantage of the omlet chef, but the eggs and bacon I got were pretty good for a mid proced hotel. One watchout is the freeway noise. The hotel is right next to it and even though my room was on the side opposite, I could still here traffic all night. Not enough to keep me awake, just enough to notice it. If you are a super light sleeper, this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a super price”
Reviews.Author: bhurlock
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is nice and in a great location for business. The room was big, very clean and had 2 big comfortable beds with a nice garden view. The staff was very friendly and very helpful and shops and restaurants are within walking distance - the free Starbucks coffee and cookies in the lobby are a bonus! We got a really great price last minute, which was a nice surprise. We'll do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Place, overpriced, but suitable for corporate stay”
Reviews.Author: Sanjovi
Reviews.Content: Fine, nice size room, very clean and good surroundings, courteous staff and good facilities pool, spa...etc. At $125, its well over prized...Free breakfast on corp purchase was fine. Good Simple choice for a nice hot breakfast. WiFi was fine. Secured and plenty of parking Good for corporate stay..but may not be fun with family.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: PHXSports
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard met our expectations. The room was very clean, staff were friendly and helpful and the parking was free. Free wireless internet was nice as well as was the area that this hotel is located, an upscale community. It was 20 minutes from downtown San Diego during non rush hour. On the downside, we could here our neighbors upstairs and next to us and the air conditioning unit was very loud, but put out nice cool air. If the price is right, I would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: PasCaLady
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott fan, but found this room design to be badly planned and would not stay here again. Very clean, nice facility in a nice location next to the freeway, but layout of room was awkward. Bathroom was to left as you enter room. Then must pass through narrow opening to get into main room. An oversized armchair was placed right next to this opening, requiring the chair to be moved before you could pull your suitcases into the room. We were constantly dodging this chair to enter the bathroom, and there was no space elsewhere in the room to get it out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service during training class”
Reviews.Author: danathan
Reviews.Content: I went for a week training class and the service was top flight. Our class was so impressed we all pitched in for an extra tip for the staff at the end of the week. The last day I had a large test and they did not have any blueberry muffins at their breakfast buffet. They made a new batch and brought them to the testing room before the test for me. They really went beyond the normal with their service.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet despite being full”
Reviews.Author: Sherry-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I used my Marriott points to stay two nights for a friends wedding. I asked for a view of the beautiful park and lake and I was happily surprised that they honored this wish. When I checked in, the hotel was filled with loud teenagers attending sports playoffs. At first, I was not happy, thinking that I would not get any rest, but the rooms are so quiet, I didn't hear a thing. The service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Webb Lake Park behind hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evan2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks during a business trip. I requested a quieter room that is farther away from the elevated freeway. The bed was comfortable; room was clean; free wired internet. I did not use wireless internet. Daily breakfast was good. I did not eat other meals at the hotel. A lovely little Webb Lake Park is behind the hotel just outside the outdoor swimming pool. The park has ducks, at least 17 turtles, and various birds. I always took a walk around the park after breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: RobinB15
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, excellent breakfast, free parking and a great location close to a really good shopping area that has pretty much anything a traveler might need and more. But what really makes this Marriott stand out are the people who work there - they will do absolutely anything to help a guest. they are always friendly, fun, courteous, and helpful with directions or any local information you might need., I had two rooms with family & friends coming in and out as we were in for a bridal shower and we were helped with extra towels, extra keys and they took the name of the guests who were arriving when we weren't there so they could get into the rooms and get ready for the shower. They also found an iphone charger when my daughter forgot hers. Also helped me carry in all the shower gifts. Couldn't have been a better stay - I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for North County SD!”
Reviews.Author: passiflorabear
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a quiet, safe, and clean suburban location, yet close to CVS, all the major banks, etc. I enjoyed the immaculately clean room, free parking, and free buffet breakfast (fresh fruit, omelet station, coffee, tea, juice, pastries galore!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Area and Very Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: a_stevens17
Reviews.Content: My husband and visited San Diego for our 1 year anniversary and since I used to live in Rancho Bernardo, I knew I wanted to stay there at least one night. It's a very quiet, small suburb of San Diego. The food is also amazing! After a lot of research and price comparing, we decided to stay at the Courtyard rather than the Radisson because it was significantly cheaper. We were not disappointed at all! The room was a very nice size, it was extremely clean and the bed was the best out of three hotels we stayed at on the trip, and that's coming from a pregnant woman! I felt that the price was reasonable and the view was lovely. We over looked the duck pond that I used to go to when I was little. Overall, the hotel was as close to perfect as you can get! I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best.”
Reviews.Author: cookiepuss76
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, and we were Not let down. They arranged for us two couples to have adjoining rooms and arranged for the shuttle to take us and pick us up from the Stone Brewery 14th Anniversary. Corey our driver was great. He also drove us to Carvers Steak house one night. The staff at this hotel are so Nice and accommodating it's unbelievable. Even though the freeway is Right There... it's not loud. It's really quite a peaceful place. There is a beautiful park on one side of the hotel (the only side I'd stay on) and a really entertaining gang of ducks. The pool and jacuzzi are clean and just right. Lots of laying out space. Great looking lounge, although I didn't find much time to do any of that. The sheets really smelled like Bleach. But very comfy. There is a fridge and safe and good drawer and closet space. HBO and good WiFi. The Bathroom had great Shower pressure (very important!). I found an extra pillow in the second drawer. The San Bernardo Winery is up the road a very short drive and a Must Do! Wine tasting (Riesling...YUM!) and a glass blowing shop and a GREAT restaurant. Oh, and a Winery too! Anyway, I'll be back and I very highly recommend this hotel. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to crash”
Reviews.Author: Craiger_AZ
Reviews.Content: Decided to give this place a try because of the positive reviews and other hotels closer to the main family attractions in San Diego were up a lot in price this year. Was not disappointed! Very friendly staff at the front desk greeted us, parking was plentiful (though the spots were traditional 'hotel small', so many large cars and SUVs end up taking 2 spots), and most importantly, the room smelled clean - not overpowering sanitizer or carpet deodorizer 'clean', just a genuine non-musty, nothing bad has been laying around non-scent. The dried up pizza crumbs underneath the TV stand/desk area can be forgiven as the rest of the room was in good order. Other positives were the supportive mattresses, abundance of different pillows, the very powerful shower pressure (so strong my spouse complained she couldn't modify it lower but I loved it) and the cleaning staff 'tucking in' my kids stuffed animals. Also, the kids liked the ducks by the 'lake' but they were too domesticated for me as they expect to be fed by every human they see and come way too close for their own safety. The pool and hot tub were standard, nice and clean but (I assume it was) the sprinklers soak all the chairs at some point in the evening. There are many things relatively close - Vons, cafes, gas stations and a Denny's up the street. Also a small shopping center called Mercado with a new Vietnamese restaurant that had one of the best bowls of Pho I've ever tasted - if you're into that sort if thing. The main attractions are mostly a decent drive away but the hotel is right next to the highway so easy navigation. Overall, this hotel was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: imanahan
Reviews.Content: THE ROOM: The hotel is a cozy four floors. My boyfriend and I had a spacious room on the third with an amazing view of the courtyard. The room was spotless, and the bed and pillows were SO comfortable. We had a quiet and peaceful sleep. Would definitely recommend. THE STAFF: The folks at the front desk always greeted us with a smile. From check-in to check-out; and the moments in between when we bought drinks in the market and borrowed a wine opener; they were absolutely friendly. The maids were also really nice and did a great job cleaning our room. THE AMENITIES: We had free coffee and hot chocolate in the mornings and had a romantic stroll around the courtyard. The weather was beautiful in April, and there ducks and turtles all around. We made plenty of use of the free high speed internet. We had a relaxing time in the jacuzzi. Enjoyed the free parking. THE LOCATION: Rancho Bernardo is a beautiful, classy part of San Diego. Unfortunately it's at least 20 minutes away from the beaches and downtown. But there are still plenty of good restaurants just down the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: GBBailey
Reviews.Content: Having traveled throughout most of the western world, it is so nice to feel at home while traveling. The staff at the Courtyard in Rancho Bernardo are easy to deal with and quick to make you feel at home. The food is great at the restaurant, and I defy you to find better wine selections. It was close to some challenging golf courses, and only a 20 minute drive to the beaches. It is a quieter area than most of San Diego, which was really nice when we were trying to wind down. The suite allowed the night owl to watch TV quietly while the rest of us slept, I am not sure how she stayed awake during the day. The only downside is that it was a little hard to find, but worth the search. Definitely worth Googling directions. Whoever is in charge there is doing a fantastic job!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comortable and good food”
Reviews.Author: dcpen43
Reviews.Content: STayed in many Courtyards. Could not fault this hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean. Staff were helpful and welcomming and the Breakfast and Dinner I had were good. Good VFM in my books.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this place”
Reviews.Author: FLR
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Courtyard Marriott. The rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel is close to the Wild Animal Park or the Zoo. We were treated warmly by the staff and they took care of all our needs, including storing our bikes. I was so pleased that I booked by next stay before checking out.

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: MarshallGulch
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to finish a long drive. Late check in no problem. Excellent beds and pillows and the room coffee was very good. Nice restaurant downstairs for breakfast and the staff was warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Courtyard - Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KKAustin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. The front desk staff people were very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are very comfortable. They were probably renovated less than a year ago and have an extremely comfortable bed. Most importantly to me, the curtains did block out all of the light so I could get a good night's rest. Many of the rooms face an inner courtyard with a small pond. I found breakfast to be very good and affordable for a buffet. As for location, it is still quite a ways from downtown San Diego. It might be good for someone wanting to stay out of the city and closer the northern areas. There are numerous restaurants and shopping nearby. I'm planning on staying at this hotel for any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, nice bed, near freeway”
Reviews.Author: Lifeisajourneyman
Reviews.Content: Reception acknowledged me as a longtime Marriot member and check-in was smooth and straightforward. Parking is easy and free, and the hotel is located at this Rancho Bernardo Ct which is "close to the freeway but far enough so that it doesn't bother you" as one other reviewer puts it. We got a Kingbed room and this was a small room, but adequate enough to have a sofa bed. The bed was very comfy and clean, and provides a good restful sleep. A refrigerator is available but the choco milk got "frozen" like ice. The bathroom had a powerful massaging shower, but the flush of the toilet was not too strong. The bathroom door is a sliding door with a lock, but I think one reviewer said he had trouble with the door having no lock? but we didnt have any problems. My very young twins enjoyed the heated outdoor pool until 9PM. Overall a good hotel for a few night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice room”
Reviews.Author: sojimenezv
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about half an hour from downtown San Diego just off the 15 freeway. The staff at the front desk seemed a little spacey. The rooms were nicely decorated and seemed like they may have been remodeled lately - I was very pleased with the room. There was a Cal King bed and a sitting area with a desk, loveseat, and coffee table. It was a little difficult to see the TV from the bed, but the loveseat was dead on. The shower was nice and my fiance and I both liked the shampoo and conditioner they provided. It was not loud at all on a Saturday night. The pool area seemed a little small, and there was a small exercise room. I got a good price from Priceline and I was happy with my stay, no real complaints but I don't seem to be as picky as some people on this site. On a side note, if you are going to do wine tastings look up the Ferrara Winery on your GPS. Don't be scared as you go through the trailer park, we almost didn't go in and it was the best winery we went to! Run by the same family for years, free tastings, and it was the only place I bought a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in beautiful Rancho Bernardo”
Reviews.Author: Giuliana S
Reviews.Content: This property is beautyfully located in Rancho Bernardo, 30 min from San Diego. Me and my husband found this place perfect for our needs. It was clean, looked like brand new, and modern. Our room overlooked the lake where a bunch of duckies were swimming. Close by there were many restaurants, grocery stores, post office and a nice bagel place. We really enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard and also the location with all the facilities. We sure come back to San Diego and we sure will stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: MarriottGold
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Gold member so (1) I travel a lot and (2) I use Marriotts in many different places. The best thing this particular Courtyard has going for it is location. Everything else seems to be average or below. It is pretty old (or looks so) and musty. Some roome even have that tobacco odor. I had to change rooms twice - one time because I was at eye level with the freeway, and second time the has empty pizza boxes and was in general not cleaned after the previous guest. Finally I get a room and the room smelled of tobacco (this is a smoe free hotel), one of the pillows has a big yellow stain, and the bathrrom was not replenished from the previous guest (half empty shampoo container - nothing new). even though I love those Marriott points, this property lacks far behind the usual high Marriott standard.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Marriott Courtyard - nothing more nothing less”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Marriott courtyard. Clearly an older property but clean and everything works. I wasn't particularly keen on the decor but that is a personal opinion. Location is good with plenty of shops and food sources within easy walking distance. The outlook is not unpleasant with a small lake/pond with ducks, etc. However the freeway borders the property so if you do want to sit outside beware the traffic noise. Pool and spa (outside) seem good enough but the gym is pokey and boasts about three bits of kit all of which look like they have seen better days - didn't use it. The standout feature for me was the reception staff whom seemed genuinely welcoming and always had a big smile. So much nicer than the 'forced' niceness of some of the big chains. I got a weekend rate of $119 + tax and as a place to kill a bit of time it was fit for purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMJohnsonNapa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married in San Diego, not far from the Rancho Bernardo Courtyard. It was a wonderful hotel. Much bigger than I imagined. The hotel actually overlooks a lake and in the morning, it is the most peaceful place that I have ever stayed. The room was nice and clean and the bathroom was very large with a huge mirror which helped immensly while getting ready for my wedding. The staff was kind and willing to help. Overall it was a great stay and I would recomend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: montu2u
Reviews.Content: WOW, Great product, awesome staff. Clean rooms with nice furnishings. Very close to freeway and a quick jump to the airport. The best staff I have encountered in quite some time. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place for a short stay, close to wild animal park.”
Reviews.Author: NICOLEandJACOB
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the courtyard after a wedding at the san diego wild animal park last weekend. we hadn't booked a room ahead of time, so when we arrived at the front desk a little after midnight, we didn't have a reservation. the guy working there was very helpful, although not particularly professional.. but i'm not complaining because he gave us the AAA rate of $116. the room was on the first floor, and was clean except for a faint must smell near the window. the bed was huge and really comfortable (not that it made a difference to me after the open bar at the wedding). the bathroom was well-stocked, the shower was spacious, the hairdryer worked well. there was a mini-fridge and a coffee maker in the room. anyway, it was really nice for one night. the hotel has obviously been through an extensive remodel recently. it's not the four seasons, but it was perfect for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at Courtyard Rancho Bernardo”
Reviews.Author: Spillthemoment
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed here for four nights in July 2006, as we were going to be attending Comic Con in San Diego and at the time we booked, we were not going to pay $500 a night for a room that is not worth that much. First of all, the drive to San Diego was not very convenient, especially with afternoon traffic. Secondly, although the room and the hotel were nice, air conditioning was awful! Even at full blast, the air conditioning in our room felt like it was on low, then on one morning we went down to have breakfast, and it was SO hot, no air conditioning, there was sweat running down the cook's face, and they ended up giving everyone their meals for free. It is a nice place, but I would only recommend it if they fix their air conditioning situation, and definitely not for people who are looking to spend time in Downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and beautifully renovated”
Reviews.Author: truthwilltell
Reviews.Content: Just recently renovated - modern and elegant.The rooms are slightly larger than the average courtyard hotel and very nice, with a little counter area with refrigerator and microwave. The staff was clueless when it came to the computer in the lobby which was for hotel guest's use. The weekend rates are usually more reasonable than the other San Diego County Courtyards. I've never paid more than 99.00 on the weekend and book through the hotel's site. Beds are comfortable. It's quiet and you'll get a good night's sleep. Free internet. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Noisy airconditioner; noisy freeway; stuffy room ==> choice between lots of noise or hot and stuffy. Try sleeping through this! Expensive breakfast when such breakfasts are usually free. Complimentary coffee in the lobby is mediocre and complimentary tea selections poor, not replenished (e.g. this morning, the only black tea was decaffeinated). No lotion in the bathroom, so don't forget your own! Reception staff ranged from very pleasant (especially the young woman who checked us in) to rather surly and unhelpful (didn't have information on breakfast terms, and didn't deliver their ignorance particularly pleasantly or helpfully). On the positive side--nice furnishings, pleasant pool, pleasant restaurant and decent food... and you couldn't be more easy-on, easy-off from the highway (actually you're not off at all).

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Rancho Bernardo
HotelInfo.Address: 11611 Bernardo Plaza Court, San Diego, CA 92128
